snippet: As officials negotiate in a last-ditch effort to spare the city the largest municipal bankruptcy in the nation’s history, residents say the city has worse problems than its $18 billion debt.
abstract: Officials in Detroit are urgently negotiating with creditors and unions in last-ditch effort to spare city from plunging into largest municipal bankruptcy in nation’s history; residents say city has worse problems than its estimated $18 billion debt, and fear bankruptcy might worsen already bare-bones services and add more stigma to city.
lead_paragraph: As officials negotiate in a last-ditch effort to spare the city the largest municipal bankruptcy in the nation’s history, residents say the city has worse problems than its $18 billion debt.

headline.main: Financial Crisis Just a Symptom of Detroit’s Woes
headline.print_headline: Financial Crisis Just a Symptom of Detroit’s Woes
